archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Mini Turkey-Quinoa Meatloaves with Garlic Mash and Roasted Broccoli
description: Family-friendly mini meatloaves bound with quinoa and herbs, glazed with a tomato-vinegar mix, served with creamy low-sodium garlic mashed potatoes and roasted broccoli. Mild flavors and classic comfort with mindful salt control.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Rinse 1 cup quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Peel and quarter 2 lb potatoes; peel 4 cloves garlic.
Finely dice 1 medium onion; chop 2 tbsp parsley.
Cut 1 large head broccoli into florets.
In a small bowl, mix 3 tbsp tomato paste, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, and 1 tsp maple syrup for the glaze.
cook_steps: Cook quinoa: Add rinsed quinoa and 2 cups water to a saucepan; bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until tender. Fluff and cool 5 minutes.
Start potatoes: Place potatoes and whole garlic in a pot, cover with water, bring to a boil, then simmer until very tender, 15–18 minutes.

Make meatloaf mix: In a bowl, combine 1.5 lb turkey, 1 cup cooked quinoa (use more if mixture seems wet), diced onion, parsley, 1 egg, 1 tbsp olive oil, and 1 tsp black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Form loaves: Divide into 8 oval mini loaves and set on the lined sheet pan. Brush tops with half the glaze.

Roast: Place loaves on upper rack and bake 20 minutes. Toss broccoli with 1 tbsp olive oil and 1/2 tsp black pepper on a second pan. Add broccoli to lower rack and roast 12–15 minutes until tender-crisp.
Glaze finish: Brush loaves with remaining glaze and roast 5–7 minutes more until cooked through (internal temp 165°F/74°C).
Mash potatoes: Drain potatoes and garlic well. Return to pot; add 3 tbsp butter, 1/2 cup milk, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Mash until smooth and creamy; adjust milk to desired texture.
Serve: Plate two mini meatloaves per person with a scoop of garlic mash and roasted broccoli.
